channel.title: Help Would Be Appriciated =D
channel.description: Hello Moparscape, I have been working on a very interesting project, I was working with two other people but they unfortunaly quit the project because of personal reasons. Anways, I'm going off topic, I came here to ask for some help. What I need help with is the following: I need a command such as ::ipban, ::mute, ::jail, ::kick, ::ban, but let's say my ingame name was Mopar, so if some admin was to type ::ban mopar they would not be able to, but would be able to ban other players. I tried to do it myself but it ended up screwing up. The last thing I need to know is Project-Insanity uses a different color base, what I mean is before it use to be @blu@ or @whi@ etc. But I do not know the new color codes, if you have them I would really appriciate it. Thanks.

item.title: Help Would Be Appriciated =D
item.dc:creator: @RsInFecTion RsInFecTion
item.description:
@RsInFecTion wrote:

Oh okay thanks anyways.

Read full topic

item.title: Help Would Be Appriciated =D
item.dc:creator: @RsInFecTion RsInFecTion
item.description:
@RsInFecTion wrote:

lilvamp11:

Any more Info, E.G, Source Base? Type? 317, 377, 474, 508, 525, 562, 602?

The Base is a PI >,> ErasedPkz if that would help.

imsuperman05:

rip it from another source, much simpler.

As I Vain I said, I would like to learn instead of leeching, thanks anyways.

[quote=“I Vain I”]The color base used has nothing to do with servers. It’s actually the client’s text-engine. Most Project Insanity servers use a client with a 459+ text-engine, which loads decimal color values via the shadow and color codes.

As for the, no ‘punishing’ the owner account; you can do something like this;

[code=Java]if (playerCommand.startsWith(“ban”)) {
try {
String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
String name = “”;

    for (int i = 0; i < args.length; i++) {
        name = args[i] + " ";
    }

    for(Player p : PlayerHandler.players) {
        if(p != null) {
            if(p.properName.equalsIgnoreCase(name)) {
                if (!p.properName.equalsIgnoreCase("OWNER")) {
                    final Client c = (Client) p;
                    p.disconnected = true;
                    Connection.addNameToBanList(name);
                    Connection.addNameToFile(name);
                } 
            }
        }
    }
} catch(Exception e) {
    e.printStackTrace();
}

}[/code]

[quote author=imsuperman05 link=topic=500880.msg3663868#msg3663868 date=1310505529]
rip it from another source, much simpler.
[/quote]Some people actually wish to learn instead of leech. So, either post useful shit, or leave.[/quote]

Sorry but im not quite understanding what you mean when u say the client text engine. And thanks for the command. I really appriciate it. i will be making the order commands using this base XD

Read full topic

The last thing I need to know is Project-Insanity uses a different color base, what I mean is before it use to be @blu@ or @whi@ etc. But I do not know the new color codes, if you have them I would really appriciate it. Thanks.
